RPM1_ESC_MASK.Description: Mask of channels which support ESC rpm telemetry. RPM telemetry of the selected channels will be averaged
RPM1_ESC_MASK.DisplayName: Bitmask of ESC telemetry channels to average

RPM1_MAX.Description: Maximum RPM to report. Only used on type = GPIO.

RPM1_MIN.Description: Minimum RPM to report. Only used on type = GPIO.

RPM1_MIN_QUAL.Description: Minimum data quality to be used

RPM1_PIN.Description: Which digital GPIO pin to use. Only used on type = GPIO. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

RPM1_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between sensor reading and RPM.

RPM1_TYPE.Description: What type of RPM sensor is connected

RPM2_ESC_MASK.Description: Mask of channels which support ESC rpm telemetry. RPM telemetry of the selected channels will be averaged
RPM2_ESC_MASK.DisplayName: Bitmask of ESC telemetry channels to average

RPM2_MAX.Description: Maximum RPM to report. Only used on type = GPIO.

RPM2_MIN.Description: Minimum RPM to report. Only used on type = GPIO.

RPM2_MIN_QUAL.Description: Minimum data quality to be used

RPM2_PIN.Description: Which digital GPIO pin to use. Only used on type = GPIO. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

RPM2_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between sensor reading and RPM.

RPM2_TYPE.Description: What type of RPM sensor is connected

RSSI_ANA_PIN.Description: Pin used to read the RSSI voltage or PWM value

RSSI_CHANNEL.Description: The channel number where RSSI will be output by the radio receiver (5 and above).

RSSI_CHAN_HIGH.Description: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_CHAN_LOW

RSSI_CHAN_LOW.Description: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_CHAN_HIGH

RSSI_PIN_HIGH.Description: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_PIN_LOW. When using pin 103, the maximum value of the parameter is 3.3V.

RSSI_PIN_LOW.Description: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_PIN_HIGH. When using pin 103, the maximum value of the parameter is 3.3V.

RSSI_TYPE.Description: Radio Receiver RSSI type. If your radio receiver supports RSSI of some kind, set it here, then set its associated RSSI_XXXXX parameters, if any.

RST_SWITCH_CH.Description: RC channel to use to reset to last flight mode after geofence takeover.

RTL_SPEED.Description: Return-to-Launch speed default. If zero use WP_SPEED or CRUISE_SPEED.

RTUN_AUTO_FILTER.Description: When enabled the PID filter settings are automatically set based on INS_GYRO_FILTER

RTUN_AUTO_SAVE.Description: Number of seconds after completion of tune to auto-save. This is useful when using a 2 position switch for quicktune

RTUN_RC_FUNC.Description: RCn_OPTION number to use to control tuning stop/start/save

RTUN_SPD_FFRATIO.Description: Ratio between measured response and CRUISE_THROTTLE value. Raise this to get a higher CRUISE_THROTTLE value

RTUN_SPD_I_RATIO.Description: Ratio between speed FF and I gain. Raise this to get a higher I gain, 0 to leave I unchanged
RTUN_SPD_I_RATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Speed FF to I ratio

RTUN_SPD_P_RATIO.Description: Ratio between speed FF and P gain. Raise this to get a higher P gain, 0 to leave P unchanged
RTUN_SPD_P_RATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Speed FF to P ratio

RTUN_STR_FFRATIO.Description: Ratio between measured response and FF gain. Raise this to get a higher FF gain
RTUN_STR_FFRATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Steering Rate FeedForward ratio

RTUN_STR_I_RATIO.Description: Ratio between steering FF and I gains. Raise this to get a higher I gain, 0 to leave I unchanged
RTUN_STR_I_RATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Steering FF to I ratio

RTUN_STR_P_RATIO.Description: Ratio between steering FF and P gains. Raise this to get a higher P gain, 0 to leave P unchanged
RTUN_STR_P_RATIO.DisplayName: Rover Quicktune Steering FF to P ratio

SAIL_ANGLE_IDEAL.Description: Ideal angle between sail and apparent wind

SAIL_ANGLE_MAX.Description: Mainsheet loose, angle between centerline and boom. For direct-control rotating masts, the rotation angle at SERVOx_MAX/_MIN; for rotating masts, this value can exceed 90 degrees if the linkages can physically rotate the mast past that angle.

SAIL_ANGLE_MIN.Description: Mainsheet tight, angle between centerline and boom

SAIL_HEEL_MAX.Description: When in auto sail trim modes the heel will be limited to this value using PID control

SAIL_LOIT_RADIUS.Description: When in sailing modes the vehicle will keep moving within this loiter radius

SAIL_NO_GO_ANGLE.Description: The typical closest angle to the wind the vehicle will sail at. the vehicle will sail at this angle when going upwind

SAIL_WNDSPD_MIN.Description: Sailboat minimum wind speed to continue sail in, at lower wind speeds the sailboat will motor if one is fitted
SAIL_WNDSPD_MIN.DisplayName: Sailboat minimum wind speed to sail in

SAIL_XTRACK_MAX.Description: The sail boat will tack when it reaches this cross track error, defines a corridor of 2 times this value wide, 0 disables
SAIL_XTRACK_MAX.DisplayName: Sailing vehicle max cross track error

SCHED_DEBUG.Description: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

SCHED_LOOP_RATE.Description: This controls the rate of the main control loop in Hz. This should only be changed by developers. This only takes effect on restart. Values over 400 are considered highly experimental.

SCHED_OPTIONS.Description: This controls optional aspects of the scheduler.

SCR_DEBUG_OPTS.Bitmask: 0:No Scripts to run message if all scripts have stopped, 1:Runtime messages for memory usage and execution time, 2:Suppress logging scripts to dataflash, 3:log runtime memory usage and execution time, 4:Disable pre-arm check

SCR_DIR_DISABLE.Description: This will stop scripts being loaded from the given locations

SCR_HEAP_SIZE.Description: Amount of memory available for scripting

SCR_USER1.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER2.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER3.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER4.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER5.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER6.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_VM_I_COUNT.Description: The number virtual machine instructions that can be run before considering a script to have taken an excessive amount of time

SERIAL0_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the USB console. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL0_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the console.

SERIAL1_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the Telem1 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL1_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:SwapTXRX, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO, 12: Ignore Streamrate
SERIAL1_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.

SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.
SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Values: -1:None,1:MAVLink1,2:MAVLink2,3:Frsky D,4:Frsky SPort,5:GPS,7:Alexmos Gimbal Serial,8:Gimbal,9:Rangefinder,10:FrSky SPort Passthrough (OpenTX),11:Lidar360,13:Beacon,14:Volz servo out,15:SBus servo out,16:ESC Telemetry,17:Devo Telemetry,18:OpticalFlow,19:RobotisServo,20:NMEA Output,21:WindVane,22:SLCAN,23:RCIN,24:EFI Serial,25:LTM,26:RunCam,27:HottTelem,28:Scripting,29:Crossfire VTX,30:Generator,31:Winch,32:MSP,33:DJI FPV,34:AirSpeed,35:ADSB,36:AHRS,37:SmartAudio,38:FETtecOneWire,39:Torqeedo,40:AIS,41:CoDevESC,42:DisplayPort,43:MAVLink High Latency,44:IRC Tramp

SERIAL2_BAUD.Description: The baud rate of the Telem2 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL2_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:SwapTXRX, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO, 12: Ignore Streamrate
SERIAL2_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.

SERIAL2_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem2 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.
SERIAL2_PROTOCOL.Values: -1:None,1:MAVLink1,2:MAVLink2,3:Frsky D,4:Frsky SPort,5:GPS,7:Alexmos Gimbal Serial,8:Gimbal,9:Rangefinder,10:FrSky SPort Passthrough (OpenTX),11:Lidar360,13:Beacon,14:Volz servo out,15:SBus servo out,16:ESC Telemetry,17:Devo Telemetry,18:OpticalFlow,19:RobotisServo,20:NMEA Output,21:WindVane,22:SLCAN,23:RCIN,24:EFI Serial,25:LTM,26:RunCam,27:HottTelem,28:Scripting,29:Crossfire VTX,30:Generator,31:Winch,32:MSP,33:DJI FPV,34:AirSpeed,35:ADSB,36:AHRS,37:SmartAudio,38:FETtecOneWire,39:Torqeedo,40:AIS,41:CoDevESC,42:DisplayPort,43:MAVLink High Latency,44:IRC Tramp

SERIAL3_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used for the Serial 3 (GPS). Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL3_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:SwapTXRX, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO, 12: Ignore Streamrate
SERIAL3_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.

SERIAL3_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol Serial 3 (GPS) should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.
SERIAL3_PROTOCOL.Values: -1:None,1:MAVLink1,2:MAVLink2,3:Frsky D,4:Frsky SPort,5:GPS,7:Alexmos Gimbal Serial,8:Gimbal,9:Rangefinder,10:FrSky SPort Passthrough (OpenTX),11:Lidar360,13:Beacon,14:Volz servo out,15:SBus servo out,16:ESC Telemetry,17:Devo Telemetry,18:OpticalFlow,19:RobotisServo,20:NMEA Output,21:WindVane,22:SLCAN,23:RCIN,24:EFI Serial,25:LTM,26:RunCam,27:HottTelem,28:Scripting,29:Crossfire VTX,30:Generator,31:Winch,32:MSP,33:DJI FPV,34:AirSpeed,35:ADSB,36:AHRS,37:SmartAudio,38:FETtecOneWire,39:Torqeedo,40:AIS,41:CoDevESC,42:DisplayPort,43:MAVLink High Latency,44:IRC Tramp

SERIAL_PASS1.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASS2.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASSTIMO.Description: This sets a timeout for serial pass-through in seconds. When the pass-through is enabled by setting the SERIAL_PASS1 and SERIAL_PASS2 parameters then it remains in effect until no data comes from the first port for SERIAL_PASSTIMO seconds. This allows the port to revent to its normal usage (such as MAVLink connection to a GCS) when it is no longer needed. A value of 0 means no timeout.

SERVO10_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

SERVO10_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO10_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO10_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

SERVO10_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO29_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO29_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

SERVO29_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO_32_ENABLE.Description: This allows for up to 32 outputs, enabling parameters for outputs above 16

SERVO_BLH_3DMASK.Bitmask: 0:Channel1,1:Channel2,2:Channel3,3:Channel4,4:Channel5,5:Channel6,6:Channel7,7:Channel8,8:Channel9,9:Channel10,10:Channel11,11:Channel12,12:Channel13,13:Channel14,14:Channel15,15:Channel16, 16:Channel 17, 17: Channel 18, 18: Channel 19, 19: Channel 20, 20: Channel 21, 21: Channel 22, 22: Channel 23, 23: Channel 24, 24: Channel 25, 25: Channel 26, 26: Channel 27, 27: Channel 28, 28: Channel 29, 29: Channel 30, 30: Channel 31, 31: Channel 32
SERVO_BLH_3DMASK.Description: Mask of channels which are dynamically reversible. This is used to configure ESCs in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction

SERVO_BLH_AUTO.Description: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors
SERVO_BLH_AUTO.DisplayName: BLHeli pass-thru auto-enable for multicopter motors

SERVO_BLH_BDMASK.Bitmask: 0:Channel1,1:Channel2,2:Channel3,3:Channel4,4:Channel5,5:Channel6,6:Channel7,7:Channel8,8:Channel9,9:Channel10,10:Channel11,11:Channel12,12:Channel13,13:Channel14,14:Channel15,15:Channel16, 16:Channel 17, 17: Channel 18, 18: Channel 19, 19: Channel 20, 20: Channel 21, 21: Channel 22, 22: Channel 23, 23: Channel 24, 24: Channel 25, 25: Channel 26, 26: Channel 27, 27: Channel 28, 28: Channel 29, 29: Channel 30, 30: Channel 31, 31: Channel 32
SERVO_BLH_BDMASK.Description: Mask of channels which support bi-directional dshot. This is used for ESCs which have firmware that supports bi-directional dshot allowing fast rpm telemetry values to be returned for the harmonic notch.
SERVO_BLH_BDMASK.DisplayName: BLHeli bitmask of bi-directional dshot channels

SERVO_BLH_DEBUG.Description: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

SERVO_BLH_MASK.Bitmask: 0:Channel1,1:Channel2,2:Channel3,3:Channel4,4:Channel5,5:Channel6,6:Channel7,7:Channel8,8:Channel9,9:Channel10,10:Channel11,11:Channel12,12:Channel13,13:Channel14,14:Channel15,15:Channel16, 16:Channel 17, 17: Channel 18, 18: Channel 19, 19: Channel 20, 20: Channel 21, 21: Channel 22, 22: Channel 23, 23: Channel 24, 24: Channel 25, 25: Channel 26, 26: Channel 27, 27: Channel 28, 28: Channel 29, 29: Channel 30, 30: Channel 31, 31: Channel 32
SERVO_BLH_MASK.Description: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

SERVO_BLH_OTYPE.Description: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

SERVO_BLH_POLES.Description: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

SERVO_BLH_PORT.Description: This sets the mavlink channel to use for blheli pass-thru. The channel number is determined by the number of serial ports configured to use mavlink. So 0 is always the console, 1 is the next serial port using mavlink, 2 the next after that and so on.
SERVO_BLH_PORT.Values: 0:Console,1:Mavlink Serial Channel1,2:Mavlink Serial Channel2,3:Mavlink Serial Channel3,4:Mavlink Serial Channel4,5:Mavlink Serial Channel5

SERVO_BLH_RVMASK.Bitmask: 0:Channel1,1:Channel2,2:Channel3,3:Channel4,4:Channel5,5:Channel6,6:Channel7,7:Channel8,8:Channel9,9:Channel10,10:Channel11,11:Channel12,12:Channel13,13:Channel14,14:Channel15,15:Channel16, 16:Channel 17, 17: Channel 18, 18: Channel 19, 19: Channel 20, 20: Channel 21, 21: Channel 22, 22: Channel 23, 23: Channel 24, 24: Channel 25, 25: Channel 26, 26: Channel 27, 27: Channel 28, 28: Channel 29, 29: Channel 30, 30: Channel 31, 31: Channel 32
SERVO_BLH_RVMASK.Description: Mask of channels which are reversed. This is used to configure ESCs in reversed mode

SERVO_BLH_TEST.Description: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

SERVO_BLH_TMOUT.Description: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

SERVO_BLH_TRATE.Description: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

SERVO_DSHOT_ESC.Description: This sets the DShot ESC type for all outputs. The ESC type affects the range of DShot commands available. None means that no dshot commands will be executed.

SERVO_DSHOT_RATE.Description: This sets the DShot output rate for all outputs as a multiple of the loop rate. 0 sets the output rate to be fixed at 1Khz for low loop rates. This value should never be set below 500Hz.

SERVO_FTW_MASK.Description: Servo channel mask specifying FETtec ESC output.

SERVO_FTW_RVMASK.Description: Servo channel mask to reverse rotation of FETtec ESC outputs.

SERVO_GPIO_MASK.Description: This sets a bitmask of outputs which will be available as GPIOs. Any output with either the function set to -1 or with the corresponding bit set in this mask will be available for use as a GPIO pin

SERVO_RATE.Description: This sets the default output rate in Hz for all outputs.

SERVO_ROB_POSMAX.Description: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

SERVO_ROB_POSMIN.Description: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

SERVO_SBUS_RATE.Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

SERVO_VOLZ_MASK.Description: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

SHIP_AUTO_OFS.Description: Settings this parameter to one triggers an automatic follow offset calculation based on current position of the vehicle and the landing target. NOTE: This parameter will auto-reset to zero once the offset has been calculated.

SHIP_LAND_ANGLE.Description: Angle from the stern of the ship for landing approach. Use this to ensure that on a go-around that ship superstructure and cables are avoided. A value of zero means to approach from the rear of the ship. A value of 90 means the landing will approach from the port (left) side of the ship. A value of -90 will mean approaching from the starboard (right) side of the ship. A value of 180 will approach from the bow of the ship. This parameter is combined with the sign of the RTL_RADIUS parameter to determine the holdoff pattern. If RTL_RADIUS is positive then a clockwise loiter is performed, if RTL_RADIUS is negative then a counter-clockwise loiter is used.

SIM_ACC_FAIL_MSK.Description: Determines if the acclerometer reading updates are stopped when for an IMU simulated failure by ACCELx_FAIL params

SIM_BAR2_RND.Description: Amount of (evenly-distributed) noise injected into the 2nd baro

SIM_BAR3_RND.Description: Amount of (evenly-distributed) noise injected into the 3rd baro

SIM_BARO_RND.Description: Amount of (evenly-distributed) noise injected into the 1st baro

SIM_FLOAT_EXCEPT.Description: If set, if a numerical error occurs SITL will die with a floating point exception.

SIM_GRPE_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the gripper servo simulation

SIM_GRPE_PIN.Description: The pin number that the gripper emp is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_GRPS_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the gripper servo simulation

SIM_GRPS_GRAB.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to initiate grabbing the cargo

SIM_GRPS_PIN.Description: The pin number that the gripper servo is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_GRPS_RELEASE.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to release the cargo

SIM_GYR1_BIAS_X.Description: First Gyro bias on X axis
SIM_GYR1_BIAS_X.DisplayName: First Gyro bias on X axis

SIM_GYR1_BIAS_Y.Description: First Gyro bias on Y axis
SIM_GYR1_BIAS_Y.DisplayName: First Gyro bias on Y axis

SIM_GYR1_BIAS_Z.Description: First Gyro bias on Z axis
SIM_GYR1_BIAS_Z.DisplayName: First Gyro bias on Z axis

SIM_GYR2_BIAS_X.Description: Second Gyro bias on X axis
SIM_GYR2_BIAS_X.DisplayName: Second Gyro bias on X axis

SIM_GYR2_BIAS_Y.Description: Second Gyro bias on Y axis
SIM_GYR2_BIAS_Y.DisplayName: Second Gyro bias on Y axis

SIM_GYR2_BIAS_Z.Description: Second Gyro bias on Z axis
SIM_GYR2_BIAS_Z.DisplayName: Second Gyro bias on Z axis

SIM_GYR3_BIAS_X.Description: Third Gyro bias on X axis
SIM_GYR3_BIAS_X.DisplayName: Third Gyro bias on X axis

SIM_GYR3_BIAS_Y.Description: Third Gyro bias on Y axis
SIM_GYR3_BIAS_Y.DisplayName: Third Gyro bias on Y axis

SIM_GYR3_BIAS_Z.Description: Third Gyro bias on Z axis
SIM_GYR3_BIAS_Z.DisplayName: Third Gyro bias on Z axis

SIM_GYR4_BIAS_X.Description: Fourth Gyro bias on X axis
SIM_GYR4_BIAS_X.DisplayName: Fourth Gyro bias on X axis

SIM_GYR4_BIAS_Y.Description: Fourth Gyro bias on Y axis
SIM_GYR4_BIAS_Y.DisplayName: Fourth Gyro bias on Y axis

SIM_GYR4_BIAS_Z.Description: Fourth Gyro bias on Z axis
SIM_GYR4_BIAS_Z.DisplayName: Fourth Gyro bias on Z axis

SIM_GYR5_BIAS_X.Description: Fifth Gyro bias on X axis
SIM_GYR5_BIAS_X.DisplayName: Fifth Gyro bias on X axis

SIM_GYR5_BIAS_Y.Description: Fifth Gyro bias on Y axis
SIM_GYR5_BIAS_Y.DisplayName: Fifth Gyro bias on Y axis

SIM_GYR5_BIAS_Z.Description: Fifth Gyro bias on Z axis
SIM_GYR5_BIAS_Z.DisplayName: Fifth Gyro bias on Z axis

SIM_GYRO_FAIL_MSK.Description: Determines if the gyro reading updates are stopped when for an IMU simulated failure by ACCELx_FAIL params

SIM_JSON_MASTER.Description: the instance number to take servos from

SIM_OH_MASK.Description: channels which are passed through to actual hardware when running sim on actual hardware

SIM_PLD_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Preland simulation

SIM_PLD_HEIGHT.Description: Precland device center's height above sealevel assume a 2x2m square as station base
SIM_PLD_HEIGHT.DisplayName: Precland device center's height above sealevel

SIM_PLD_RATE.Description: Precland device rate. e.g led patter refresh rate, RF message rate, etc.

SIM_PLD_TYPE.Description: Precland device radiance type: it can be a cylinder, a cone, or a sphere.

SIM_PLD_YAW.Description: Precland device systems rotation from north
SIM_PLD_YAW.DisplayName: Precland device systems rotation from north

SIM_RC_FAIL.Description: Allows you to emulate rc failures in sim
SIM_RC_FAIL.Values: 0:Disabled,1:No RC pusles,2:All Channels neutral except Throttle is 950us

SIM_SAIL_TYPE.Description: 0: mainsail with sheet, 1: directly actuated wing

SIM_SPEEDUP.Description: Runs the simulation at multiples of normal speed. Do not use if realtime physics, like RealFlight, is being used

SIM_SPR_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Sprayer simulation

SIM_SPR_PUMP.Description: The pin number that the Sprayer pump is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_SPR_SPIN.Description: The pin number that the Sprayer spinner servo is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_UART_LOSS.Description: Sets percentage of outgoing byte loss on UARTs

SIM_WIND_DIR.Description: Allows you to set wind direction (true deg) in sim

SIM_WIND_SPD.Description: Allows you to emulate wind in sim

SIM_WIND_TURB.Description: Allows you to emulate random wind variations in sim

SIM_WIND_T_.Description: Selects how wind varies from surface to WIND_T_ALT

SIM_WIND_T_ALT.Description: Altitude at which wind reaches full strength, decaying from full strength as altitude lowers to ground level

SIM_WIND_T_COEF.Description: For linear wind profile,wind is reduced by (Altitude-WIND_T_ALT) x this value

SIM_WOW_PIN.Description: SITL set this simulated pin to true if vehicle is on ground

SPEED_MAX.Description: Maximum speed vehicle can obtain at full throttle. If 0, it will be estimated based on CRUISE_SPEED and CRUISE_THROTTLE.

SPRAY_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the sprayer

SPRAY_PUMP_MIN.Description: Minimum pump speed expressed as a percentage

SPRAY_PUMP_RATE.Description: Desired pump speed when traveling 1m/s expressed as a percentage

SPRAY_SPEED_MIN.Description: Speed minimum at which we will begin spraying

SPRAY_SPINNER.Description: Spinner's rotation speed in PWM (a higher rate will disperse the spray over a wider area horizontally)

SR0_EXTRA1.DisplayName: Extra data type 1 stream rate to ground station

SR0_EXTRA3.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of AHRS, SYSTEM_TIME, WIND, RANGEFINDER, DISTANCE_SENSOR, BATTERY2, BATTERY_STATUS, GIMBAL_DEVICE_ATTITUDE_STATUS, OPTICAL_FLOW, MAG_CAL_REPORT, MAG_CAL_PROGRESS, EKF_STATUS_REPORT, VIBRATION, RPM, ESC TELEMETRY, and WHEEL_DISTANCE

SR5_EXTRA1.DisplayName: Extra data type 1 stream rate to ground station

SR5_EXTRA3.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of AHRS, SYSTEM_TIME, WIND, RANGEFINDER, DISTANCE_SENSOR, BATTERY2, BATTERY_STATUS, GIMBAL_DEVICE_ATTITUDE_STATUS, OPTICAL_FLOW, MAG_CAL_REPORT, MAG_CAL_PROGRESS, EKF_STATUS_REPORT, VIBRATION, RPM, ESC TELEMETRY, and WHEEL_DISTANCE

SR5_EXT_STAT.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of SYS_STATUS, POWER_STATUS, MCU_STATUS, MEMINFO, CURRENT_WAYPOINT, GPS_RAW_INT, GPS_RTK (if available), GPS2_RAW_INT (if available), GPS2_RTK (if available), NAV_CONTROLLER_OUTPUT, FENCE_STATUS, and GLOBAL_TARGET_POS_INT

SR5_POSITION.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of GLOBAL_POSITION_INT and LOCAL_POSITION_NED

SR5_RAW_CTRL.Description: MAVLink Raw Control stream rate of SERVO_OUT

SR5_RAW_SENS.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of RAW_IMU, SCALED_IMU2, SCALED_IMU3, SCALED_PRESSURE, SCALED_PRESSURE2, and SCALED_PRESSURE3

SR5_RC_CHAN.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of SERVO_OUTPUT_RAW and RC_CHANNELS

SR6_EXTRA1.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of ATTITUDE, SIMSTATE (SIM only), AHRS2 and PID_TUNING
SR6_EXTRA1.DisplayName: Extra data type 1 stream rate to ground station

SR6_EXTRA3.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of AHRS, SYSTEM_TIME, WIND, RANGEFINDER, DISTANCE_SENSOR, BATTERY2, BATTERY_STATUS, GIMBAL_DEVICE_ATTITUDE_STATUS, OPTICAL_FLOW, MAG_CAL_REPORT, MAG_CAL_PROGRESS, EKF_STATUS_REPORT, VIBRATION, RPM, ESC TELEMETRY, and WHEEL_DISTANCE

SR6_EXT_STAT.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of SYS_STATUS, POWER_STATUS, MCU_STATUS, MEMINFO, CURRENT_WAYPOINT, GPS_RAW_INT, GPS_RTK (if available), GPS2_RAW_INT (if available), GPS2_RTK (if available), NAV_CONTROLLER_OUTPUT, FENCE_STATUS, and GLOBAL_TARGET_POS_INT

SR6_POSITION.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of GLOBAL_POSITION_INT and LOCAL_POSITION_NED

SR6_RAW_CTRL.Description: MAVLink Raw Control stream rate of SERVO_OUT

SR6_RAW_SENS.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of RAW_IMU, SCALED_IMU2, SCALED_IMU3, SCALED_PRESSURE, SCALED_PRESSURE2, and SCALED_PRESSURE3

SR6_RC_CHAN.Description: MAVLink Stream rate of SERVO_OUTPUT_RAW and RC_CHANNELS

SRTL_ACCURACY.Description: SmartRTL accuracy. The minimum distance between points.

SRTL_POINTS.Description: SmartRTL maximum number of points on path. Set to 0 to disable SmartRTL. 100 points consumes about 3k of memory.
SRTL_POINTS.DisplayName: SmartRTL maximum number of points on path

STAT_BOOTCNT.Description: Number of times board has been booted

STAT_RESET.Description: Seconds since January 1st 2016 (Unix epoch+1451606400) since statistics reset (set to 0 to reset statistics)

STICK_MIXING.Description: When enabled, this adds steering user stick input in auto modes, allowing the user to have some degree of control without changing modes.

SYSID_ENFORCE.Description: This controls whether packets from other than the expected GCS system ID will be accepted

SYSID_MYGCS.Description: The identifier of the ground station in the MAVLink protocol. Don't change this unless you also modify the ground station to match.

SYSID_THISMAV.Description: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network
SYSID_THISMAV.DisplayName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle

TELEM_DELAY.Description: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

TEMP1_ADDR.Description: Temperature sensor address, typically used for I2C address

TEMP1_BUS.Description: Temperature sensor bus number, typically used to select from multiple I2C buses

TEMP1_SRC.Description: Sensor Source is used to designate which device's temperature report will be replaced by this temperature sensor's data. If 0 (None) then the data is only available via log. In the future a new Motor temperature report will be created for returning data directly.

TEMP1_SRC_ID.Description: Sensor Source Identification is used to replace a specific instance of a system component's temperature report with the temp sensor's. Examples: TEMP_SRC = 1 (ESC), TEMP_SRC_ID = 1 will set the temp of ESC1. TEMP_SRC = 3 (BatteryIndex),TEMP_SRC_ID = 2 will set the temp of BATT2. TEMP_SRC = 4 (BatteryId/SerialNum),TEMP_SRC_ID=42 will set the temp of all batteries that have param BATTn_SERIAL = 42.

TEMP2_BUS.Description: Temperature sensor bus number, typically used to select from multiple I2C buses

TEMP2_SRC.Description: Sensor Source is used to designate which device's temperature report will be replaced by this temperature sensor's data. If 0 (None) then the data is only available via log. In the future a new Motor temperature report will be created for returning data directly.

TRQD_DE_PIN.Description: Pin number connected to RS485 to Serial converter's DE pin. -1 to use serial port's CTS pin if available

TRQD_DIR_DELAY.Description: Torqeedo direction change delay. Output will remain at zero for this many seconds when transitioning between forward and backwards rotation

TRQD_ONOFF_PIN.Description: Pin number connected to Torqeedo's on/off pin. -1 to use serial port's RTS pin if available

TRQD_POWER.Description: Torqeedo motor power. Only applied when using motor connection type (e.g. TRQD_TYPE=2)

TRQD_SLEW_TIME.Description: Torqeedo slew rate specified as the minimum number of seconds required to increase the throttle from 0 to 100%. Higher values cause a slower response, lower values cause a faster response. A value of zero disables the limit

TURN_RADIUS.Description: Turn radius of vehicle in meters while at low speeds. Lower values produce tighter turns in steering mode

VISO_DELAY_MS.Description: Visual odometry sensor delay relative to inertial measurements

VISO_POS_M_NSE.Description: Visual odometry position measurement noise minimum (meters). This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

VISO_POS_X.Description: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.
VISO_POS_X.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera X position offset

VISO_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.
VISO_POS_Y.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera Y position offset

VISO_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.
VISO_POS_Z.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera Z position offset

VISO_SCALE.Description: Visual odometry scaling factor applied to position estimates from sensor

VISO_VEL_M_NSE.Description: Visual odometry velocity measurement noise in m/s

VISO_YAW_M_NSE.Description: Visual odometry yaw measurement noise minimum (radians), This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

VTX_ENABLE.Description: Toggles the Video Transmitter on and off
VTX_ENABLE.DisplayName: Is the Video Transmitter enabled or not

VTX_FREQ.Description: Video Transmitter Frequency. The frequency is derived from the setting of BAND and CHANNEL

VTX_MAX_POWER.Description: Video Transmitter Maximum Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, this prevents the power aux switch from requesting too high a power level. The switch supports 6 power levels and the selected power will be a subdivision between 0 and this setting.

VTX_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:Pitmode,1:Pitmode until armed,2:Pitmode when disarmed,3:Unlocked,4:Add leading zero byte to requests,5:Use 1 stop-bit in SmartAudio,6:Ignore CRC in SmartAudio,7:Ignore status updates in CRSF and blindly set VTX options
VTX_OPTIONS.Description: Video Transmitter Options. Pitmode puts the VTX in a low power state. Unlocked enables certain restricted frequencies and power levels. Do not enable the Unlocked option unless you have appropriate permissions in your jurisdiction to transmit at high power levels. One stop-bit may be required for VTXs that erroneously mimic iNav behaviour.

VTX_POWER.Description: Video Transmitter Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, the power level chosen will be rounded down to the nearest supported power level

WENC2_CPR.Description: WheelEncoder 2 counts per full revolution of the wheel

WENC2_POS_X.Description: X position of the center of the second wheel in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

WENC2_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the center of the second wheel in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

WENC2_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the center of the second wheel in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

WENC2_TYPE.Description: What type of WheelEncoder sensor is connected

WENC_CPR.Description: WheelEncoder counts per full revolution of the wheel

WENC_POS_X.Description: X position of the center of the wheel in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

WENC_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the center of the wheel in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

WENC_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the center of the wheel in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

WENC_TYPE.Description: What type of WheelEncoder is connected

WNDVN_CAL.Description: Start wind vane calibration by setting this to 1 or 2

WNDVN_DIR_DZ.Description: Wind vane deadzone when using analog sensor
WNDVN_DIR_DZ.DisplayName: Wind vane deadzone when using analog sensor

WNDVN_DIR_FILT.Description: apparent Wind vane direction low pass filter frequency, a value of -1 disables filter
WNDVN_DIR_FILT.DisplayName: apparent Wind vane direction low pass filter frequency

WNDVN_DIR_OFS.Description: Angle offset when analog windvane is indicating a headwind, ie 0 degress relative to vehicle

WNDVN_DIR_PIN.Description: Analog input pin to read as wind vane direction
WNDVN_DIR_PIN.DisplayName: Wind vane analog voltage pin for direction

WNDVN_DIR_V_MAX.Description: Maximum voltage supplied by analog wind vane. When using pin 103, the maximum value of the parameter is 3.3V.

WNDVN_DIR_V_MIN.Description: Minimum voltage supplied by analog wind vane. When using pin 103, the maximum value of the parameter is 3.3V.

WNDVN_SPEED_FILT.Description: apparent Wind speed low pass filter frequency, a value of -1 disables filter
WNDVN_SPEED_FILT.DisplayName: apparent wind speed low pass filter frequency

WNDVN_SPEED_MIN.Description: Wind vane direction will be ignored when apparent wind speeds are below this value (if wind speed sensor is present). If the apparent wind is consistently below this value the vane will not work
WNDVN_SPEED_MIN.DisplayName: Wind vane cut off wind speed

WNDVN_SPEED_OFS.Description: Wind sensor analog voltage offset at zero wind speed
WNDVN_SPEED_OFS.DisplayName: Wind speed sensor analog voltage offset

WNDVN_SPEED_PIN.Description: Wind speed analog speed input pin for Modern Devices Wind Sensor rev. p
WNDVN_SPEED_PIN.DisplayName: Wind vane speed sensor analog pin

WNDVN_SPEED_TYPE.Values: 0:None,1:Airspeed library,2:Modern Devices Wind Sensor,3:RPM library,4:NMEA,10:SITL true,11:SITL apparent

WNDVN_TEMP_PIN.Description: Wind speed sensor analog temp input pin for Modern Devices Wind Sensor rev. p, set to -1 to diasble temp readings
WNDVN_TEMP_PIN.DisplayName: Wind vane speed sensor analog temp pin

WNDVN_TRUE_FILT.Description: True speed and direction low pass filter frequency, a value of -1 disables filter
WNDVN_TRUE_FILT.DisplayName: True speed and direction low pass filter frequency

WNDVN_TYPE.Values: 0:None,1:Heading when armed,2:RC input offset heading when armed,3:Analog,4:NMEA,10:SITL true,11:SITL apparent

WP_ACCEL.Description: Waypoint acceleration. If zero then ATC_ACCEL_MAX is used

WP_JERK.Description: Waypoint jerk (change in acceleration). If zero then jerk is same as acceleration

WP_PIVOT_ANGLE.Description: Pivot when the difference between the vehicle's heading and its target heading is more than this many degrees. Set to zero to disable pivot turns. This parameter should be greater than 5 degrees for pivot turns to work.

WP_PIVOT_DELAY.Description: Vehicle waits this many seconds after completing a pivot turn before proceeding

WP_RADIUS.Description: The distance in meters from a waypoint when we consider the waypoint has been reached. This determines when the vehicle will turn toward the next waypoint.

WRC2_RATE_D.Description: Wheel rate control D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired rate vs actual

WRC2_RATE_FF.Description: Wheel rate control feed forward gain. Desired rate (in radians/sec) is multiplied by this constant and output to output (in the range -1 to +1)
WRC2_RATE_FF.DisplayName: Wheel rate control feed forward gain

WRC2_RATE_FILT.Description: Wheel rate control input filter. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

WRC2_RATE_FLTD.Description: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz
WRC2_RATE_FLTD.DisplayName: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz

WRC2_RATE_FLTE.Description: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz
WRC2_RATE_FLTE.DisplayName: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz

WRC2_RATE_FLTT.Description: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz
WRC2_RATE_FLTT.DisplayName: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz

WRC2_RATE_I.Description: Wheel rate control I gain. Corrects long term error between the desired rate (in rad/s) and actual

WRC2_RATE_IMAX.Description: Wheel rate control I gain maximum. Constrains the output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate
WRC2_RATE_IMAX.DisplayName: Wheel rate control I gain maximum

WRC2_RATE_P.Description: Wheel rate control P gain. Converts rate error (in radians/sec) to output (in the range -1 to +1)

WRC2_RATE_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

WRC_ENABLE.Description: Enable or disable wheel rate control

WRC_RATE_D.Description: Wheel rate control D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired rate vs actual

WRC_RATE_FF.Description: Wheel rate control feed forward gain. Desired rate (in radians/sec) is multiplied by this constant and output to output (in the range -1 to +1)
WRC_RATE_FF.DisplayName: Wheel rate control feed forward gain

WRC_RATE_FILT.Description: Wheel rate control input filter. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

WRC_RATE_FLTD.Description: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz
WRC_RATE_FLTD.DisplayName: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz

WRC_RATE_FLTE.Description: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz
WRC_RATE_FLTE.DisplayName: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz

WRC_RATE_FLTT.Description: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz
WRC_RATE_FLTT.DisplayName: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz

WRC_RATE_I.Description: Wheel rate control I gain. Corrects long term error between the desired rate (in rad/s) and actual

WRC_RATE_IMAX.Description: Wheel rate control I gain maximum. Constrains the output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate
WRC_RATE_IMAX.DisplayName: Wheel rate control I gain maximum

WRC_RATE_P.Description: Wheel rate control P gain. Converts rate error (in radians/sec) to output (in the range -1 to +1)

WRC_RATE_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.
